title: Promoting a Quarkus app with resource limits in the deployment-config leads to request queuing and thread blocks, impairing functionality. Without limits, the app performs well.
body:
Dear,

When subjected to limits specified in the deployment-config, the application only seems to handle one request at a time, queuing subsequent requests. This results in multiple thread blocks, causing the application to malfunction.

Without specified limits, the application handles multiple simultaneous requests as expected, with a low response time.

Is there an issue with running an application without limits? If so, how can we determine appropriate settings for Quarkus applications, or configure Quarkus to support "n" simultaneous requests without overburdening the environment?
